title: HELP

embed.description: Every time I start a league game, I go into champion select and all goes well until I begin waiting for the loading screen. The league of legends logo will open and then my screen goes black for a little while and then closes.

body: I submitted that and got a response but it's still not working -.-

replies.body: So, if that generic firewall fix didn't work for you, you might have to reinstall. I wouldn't do that right away, though. Wait two days for the next patch to come out and see if that fixes it.
I've re-installed twice. The new patch is out and it's still happening :/

Ok, so right now, you're able to log in, queue up, and it's only when you try to get into game is just doesn't load?

Go through your firewall. I know that it's set to automatically let League through, but maybe the version numbers have changed and hence you need to change it yourself.

So I log on go into queue and all is good. It's just when my loading screen comes up I get a black screen for a couple of seconds and it closes. If i leave it like that for a little, I can hear my game sound and the game starting like 'Welcome to summoners rift' etc.

I went into my firewall and still nothing is working :/

OH

OH

THAT'S NOT A CONNECTION ISSUE

That's definitely hardware. What graphics card do you have, if any?
I have an NVIDIA GeForce 9400 GT. I can run minecraft and CSGO perfectly fine but not league :/ Is it because of my graphics card?

Oh jesus that's expensive.

You shouldn't be getting issues with that. Do you have the latest updates installed for it? You can check on [this site](http://www.geforce.com/drivers).

Everything is all up to date. What I have noticed is that when I go into a bot game, all is fine but if it's with other people I have that problem. Also, will i be able to get that 20 min wait before going in queue at least?

So, if you're in a custom game by yourself, with bots accompanying you, then the game loads fine and everything is working? As in, you are able to load it correctly. If that's true, then being in a game connected to other people is what's causing this to happen on your computer, BUT the error you are getting is not a "Connection failed" or anything like that, it's a critical part of hardware failing to boot up i.e. your display.

I don't understand how this is possible.

Are you 100% that it's not something silly like League is configured to use a resolution that your monitor doesn't support (even though, that would mean you couldn't get the custom game running)? That you don't have another program installed which is causing your screen to black out if it detects a PvP connection?

This is just unbelievable. What happens if you make a custom game with bots, and one friend in it? Does your screen remain black? Is your friend able to see you move/speak in the chat?

A couple of times while going into a game and getting my black screen, I get 'connection failed' or something along those lines. Everything else is working fine and my PC is connected to the internet. I really don't believe it either. If it's a custom game with bots it's perfectly fine but everything else it will bring up a black screen :/

What PC do you have? Who's the manufacturer?

Have you made a support ticket about this yet?
